oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of an American solider with artillery piece
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows an American soldier standing with arm resting on what is most likely a French 75 mm artillery piece. The gun is parked in front of a barn and visible just inside the open door is another American soldier with his back to the camera. This photograph is part of a large collection of Still Images belonging to Sgt. Ernest P. West, Batry. B, 114th F.A. Regt., 30th Div. Most American artillery units deployed to France used French guns.
